name: The Sainte Claire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my husband so we could visit the Winchester Mystery House (I wrote a review of my disappointment under that attraction). We enjoyed the hotel and it felt like a lovely, historically significant building and I truly enjoyed it. If you want uber-modern don't stay here. If you enjoy vintage luxury select this hotel. I even had a lovely time reading near the fire in the lobby while my husband took his time getting ready to head out. I was impressed with the mattress and bedding and fell in LOVE with the amazing pillows. Seriously, they are the best I have ever slept on.
reviews.title: Lovely historical feeling building with the best pillows I have EVER slept on

reviews.text: The St. Claire is easy walking distance of several things to do and we took advantage of the chance to keep the car parked as we took in the area. Do be aware that the area appears to be transitional. Parts are quite chic and upper crust while there is a seedy underbelly that is peaking it's head through the veil from time to time. There appears to be a significant population of mentally ill and drug abusing homeless in pockets nearby. While there we witnessed two fights break out and had one mentally ill lady chase us down the street until we went into a small bodega style grocery. I wouldn't say stay totally clear, just be advised to pay attention.
reviews.title: Not a good value and needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is positioned to be the premium hotel but it is quite run-down and needs a lot of updating. Bathrooms are in dire need of that. Carpets are all dusty. If you include the price of the parking it gets to Marriot price. Beds are also uncomfortable and AC is in the room and so unbelievably noisy, just blasts loudly. Overall, cannot recommend it.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: Wanted to choose Dolyce mansion, but decided to choose this instead for an exceptional offer on expedia.
reviews.title: Heartily recommend and I will be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, we werent disappointed. The place is great after the refurbishment... The bed is soft and great. The room is spacious and my wife was excited over the Loccitane products...
reviews.title: Lovely and friendly

reviews.text: Attended a wedding and stayed at the hotel for three nights. No problems throughout the stay. Hotel was very accomodating and welcoming to a large wedding.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.text: Boyfriend was moving from S. California to Oregon and stopped for the wedding for three days. Hotel was very accomodating with his car valeted with all his moving stuff and even stored his bike and surfboard for him!!!
reviews.title: nice building, TERRIBLE service

likes.disliked: — absolutely terrible front desk staff. Rude, incompetent

reviews.text: Beautiful rooms and lobby. Amazing reception and food. On site resturant was yummy every time. Walking distance to shopping, trolley, sights, food.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel with lots of character

likes.liked: — the location, the price and the amenities
likes.disliked: — I don't think they a had a pool or jacuzzi- I'm not sure

reviews.text: The hotel is a lovely old building, with nice (though small) rooms. Unfortunately, I had one of the worst customer experiences I have ever encountered at a hotel while staying there.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Except for the Noise

likes.liked: — Nice furnishings, great staff, good location, clean, free Internet access

reviews.text: I booked *AND PRE-PAID* my room for an 8-day stay through the hotel's own website. Upon arrival, they had no record of the reservation, though they put me up in a room while they figured out what happened to my prepaid reservation. The next day, they told me that they had found the reservation, and that all was resolved. A couple of days later, I got a call from my credit card company, telling me that the hotel had charged my card for the stay (*not* the company card we used to book the reservation).
reviews.title: A classic hotel with classic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited this hotel last year and there have been a few changes since then. The rooms have been renovated (new plasma tv, some new furniture, etc.). This definitely made my stay much more enjoyable. The staff were friendly as before and helpful. Drinks at Il Fornio were good as well. Also, take advantage of the dvd library available at the front desk. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: 2nd Time Here

reviews.text: Despite it's historic character, something just didn't feel right about the Sainte Claire, and part of me almost longed to stay at the modern Marriott or Fairmont across the street.
reviews.title: A pig in lipstick, I'm afraid...

reviews.text: Sure, it's got some good things going for it, but it's lacking in a number of areas.
reviews.title: Very nice accomodations at the St Claire

reviews.text: When I arrived, it seemed that the hotel had lost my reservation, but it wasn't clear that this was the case, there was just a lot of frenetic mashing around inside the front desk computer system by a frowning desk clerk, who asked me to repeat my name a lot.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: One key thing which struck me, as a business traveller, was that there were no power outlets on the desk, nor any clear information regarding the (free) wireless internet access - which incidentally was very good, as it even gave you the option of a real, globally-routeable, or a private (NAT-ed) IP address - the former being essential for VPN users.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sainte Claire for a week for a business trip because the usual hotel I stay at was fully booked. As I checked in, they offered me a free upgrade because of the length of my stay - very impressed. The King size room is a bit bigger than the standard room. It has a king bed, a sofa and a desk with a little fridge. Again, the rooms have a very classic look and feel. Everything was very clean and I didn't have any issues with noise as stated in some of the other reviews. The beds are very comfortable but they went a bit overboard with the heavy duvet and cover - I thought I was going suffocate under such heavy blankets. The air conditioning is quite noisy when it turns on every 5 minutes. My other minor complaint is the lack of in-room entertainment system (pay per view movies). They have a DVD library at the front desk. I guess this goes with the old style thing... The free WiFi was quite fast and stable. The location is fine - walking distance to many restaurants, bars, Safeway and theater.
reviews.title: Classic Hotel With Excellent Service

reviews.text: Despite the above minor issues, I enjoyed my stay and I got a much better rate than at the other large downtown hotels. Great value!
reviews.title: New Year's Eve Gem

reviews.text: My family and I booked two rooms for New Year's Eve even though we live locally. We have eaten many times at their restaurant, Il Fornaio, which we love so we decided to stay overnight for New Year's Eve because we love the quiet elegance and the old world flavor. Last year we stayed at another hotel that is much newer down the street and it was a complete zoo - people reserving one room (and inviting 10 friends to spend the night). People standing in the check in line with huge rolling coolers. And the noise level was incredible. Back to the Saint Claire - friendly, extremely helpful staff especially the front desk manager. He couldn't do enough for us. He provided a list of free DVDs (great selection and lots of current releases) to check out. He helped us get some sodas and snacks without having to call room service, and when we checked out, he even gave us a package of nuts as a parting gift which was so sweet of him. We felt so special. The rooms are comfortable with a flat screen tv, DVD player, wifi, comfortable beds and a window that you could open and enjoy fresh air. The bathroom had a painted sky with stars painted on the ceiling. We enjoyed the elegant lobby and sitting room with the big comfy chairs and sofas. And most of all, in spite of a wedding taking place in the ballroom, we enjoyed the quiet. It was so relaxing. Christmas in the Park is situated right across the street and we had fun walking around the various displays. The movie theaters are very close and we enjoyed the walk. The room has a small refrigerator where we stored our champagne until midnight. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Great pricing and a great elegant and classy hotel.
reviews.title: Old Style Beauty, Service and Hospitality

reviews.text: I chose the Ste. Claire for its location to our business at hand, the reviews on T.A. and the amenities listed such as free internet and 24 hour room service. Also, between The Hilton, Sheraton, and a few others I looked into, I got the best rate here. We have a winner!
reviews.title: Classic style but a bit noisy

reviews.text: What was meant to be a quick trip turned into a 5 day stay. Upon arrival the valet and door man were professional and welcoming as were the front desk staff. My husband and I were not disappointed at the beauty of the lobby (a mirrored wall gives the impression of a major hall being ten tiimes larger than it is - a great illusion) or the proximity to the entrance to Il Fornaio Restaurant, which I now believe, should be included in many more hotels!!!
reviews.title: Didn't stay, but...

reviews.text: I stayed for two nights in late Sept. 2011 at the Sainte Claire on a business trip to San Jose State University (which is walking distance from the hotel). The hotel has a very elegant, sort of British colonial feel, with nicely appointed lobby and lounge areas. My room was comfortable (with a very comfortable bed) and quiet--I was on the non-street side. The somewhat small bathroom had a great little illuminated recessed ceiling with sky and clouds, and the room had all amenities--including a small fridge. I had breakfast at Il Forino each morning--very good food and service--and drinks/appetizers in the bar. Be forewarned that parking is valet only ($22 per day); there is free Internet service and a manager's reception two evenings a week. The hotel is walking distance from a number of good restaurants as well as an excellent Safeway called "The Market" on 2nd street, with a fine selection of wines.
reviews.title: Lovely, elegant hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here on a business trip for a week. The room was comfortable; the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was small, but very cute. I loved the painted, recessed ceiling. The traffic noise, flights and surface streets, was minimal.
reviews.title: Cozy and comfortable
below average
reviews.text: I ate breakfast everyday at Il Forino. It was prepared well, plated well, and served with distinction. Wonderful start to my mornings.
The hotel has a charm that takes you back to a time when people socialized in sport coats and evening dresses. The decor is well kept and the staff was gracious.
reviews.title: Vintage hotel refurbished

reviews.text: My only complaint would be that parking is difficult and there was a bit of a wait to have the car brought up from valet.
reviews.title: Beautiful Way to Spend a Night in San Jose
Memorable Historic Hotel With Great Service
reviews.text: We stayed for a Saturday night to be right in downtown for the museums and a home show at the Convention Center. Parking is free at the city lots after 6pm and all day on the weekends, so we used that parking instead of the valet service. We felt safe leaving the car; as the lots near the hotel are nearly always full and there is plenty of activity going at all hours. The check-in was quick and easy. Since I had booked a special package deal directly at Hyatt's Website, I was told I had $30 in food and beverage credit at the Il Fornaio restaurant as well as a bottle of champaign to be delivered. The front desk set up my dinner reservations right away, scheduled a delivery time for the chilled champaign, and gave us a great room on the top floor looking out at the towering Marriott and the convention center. After looking at the Marriott's hotel highrise, we knew that we had made the right decison to go with the Sainte Claire and its unique personality. Our room was not standard, as we had an oversized room with a great big fireplace. Since it was a nice weekend, a fire was not used, but the grand setting of a huge fireplace in the room was very romantic. The ceilings were high with crown moldings and lots of little touches adorned the walls like various photographs and artwork in different styles of frames. The 19" televison is small; perhaps that would be my only complaint, since there was easily room for a 25" or 27" model. The bed was very comfy, with triple sheeting and a feather bed. The bath area was very clean with wonderful old tile work, a beautiful teak vanity, and an inset ceiling light that was painted to look like a skylight with birds flying above. The water pressure was more than adequate and the water temperature was perfect. I'm not sure what may have caused other reviewers to have problems, but we did not encounter any. I had never stayed at this hotel before, and am only a Hyatt Platinum member, but I was treated very well, with the staff I encountered remembering my name and always asking how my stay was going. Dinner at the Il Fornaio restaurant was excellent, and was a great way to end a day of sightseeing. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who likes things a bit different. Yes, you can hear the street noise below, and yes, you may even hear some noise occasionally from the hallways, but this is part of being in a old hotel in a city setting. I actually enjoy a bit of city noise every now and then. This is a very nicely renovated historic building with wonderful architecture and a lot of history. People that enjoy only modern hotel room layouts, soundproofing, and decor may wish to go to the Marriott, Hilton, or Fairmont instead. For me, I was most pleased with the Hyatt Sainte Claire, and would definitely return.

My partner and I stayed at the Sainte Claire May 7, 2005 and we really enjoyed the place. We did ask for a room away from the metro, but to be honest, the metro really doesn't run too much around there. If you don't appreciate historic places, don't stay here. The room was very clean and staff was helpful. Note on weekend after 6pm, all of the parking lots are free, unless you want to pay the $18 for valet. You can't park anywhere on the streets from like 3am-6am.
reviews.title: Great Location, price right, clean, historic
I too was alittle scared!
reviews.text: I too was scared by the previous reviews after getting my hotel on Priceline, I even tried to cancel after reading the reviews. I think the hotel was very nice, I loved the way the rooms reflected the era, like a step back in time. The rooms are small though-due to the age I am sure. We stayed on a Friday night also, and I had 3 teenage girls with me (see below review!), they thought the hotel was haunted which intriged them even more, they were sure the little funny things that happened were due to the ghosts, like hearing laughing in the middle of the night (in the room) & my daughter ending up on the floor sleeping in the middle of the night, but who knows, they thought it was great! Service was ok, I didn't eat at the resturant, but it looked very crowded. They do need new TV, not very clear reception and small and the street noise did bother me, but turned on the heater and it "banged" out the noise. The girls were dissappointed there was no pool. Overall I would stay here again, it was a great deal on Priceline - $60 for the night, but stay on the other side of the hotel away from the rail system.

reviews.title: Don't be scared by bad reviews -- mostly quiet, central, nice, old-fashioned hotel
reviews.text: After winning a room at the Hyatt Sainte Claire on Priceline for a Friday-night business stay, I was scared by some of the negative reviews here--I'm a light sleeper, and the alleged party atmosphere of this hotel and thin walls were a little intimidating. Checking in and seeing that my hotel overlooked the main street--with light-rail running right outside--made me nervous all over again, as did the group of teenage girls down the hall.

reviews.title: Oh boy - stay away!!!!
reviews.text: Luckily, the noise level was mostly non-existent--with the window closed and the curtain shut, there was very little ambient noise coming in from the street, and none that I heard from any other guests in the hotel.

Stayed at the Saint Claire for a week during a sales meeting. The hotel is really nice, the bedrooms are furnished very well and the place has a great old charm to it. Reminds me of a boutique New York hotel. My room had nice furniture a pretty large flat screen TV and a great bathroom. The tilework in the bathroom has to be old because it would be too expensive to do now. Make sure you check out the bathroom ceiling fresco. Some of my co-workes said the walls were thin, I could hear the guy in the next room coughing, but nothing that kept me from sleeping though.
reviews.title: Classic New York Style Hotel in San Jose

reviews.text: I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Musty old VERY uncomfortable hotel

reviews.text: Needs severe refurbishment. I have no idea how this hotel got good ratings. I live in hotels for work, and this one by far was the most uncomfortable creepy hotel. Everything was wet in my room. The towels were damp before I even turned on the shower. It clearly has a problem controlling the humidity so all the rooms had a very musty URINE smell. The only positive thing was the window could open to air it out.
reviews.title: A classy, but accessible hotel stay

reviews.text: If you like older, charming venues, then this classic hotel is right for you. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. It began with the reservations desk. My reservation had been mistakenly cancelled. Just prior to arriving, I called and there was no record of my reservation. They went out of their way to help make accommodations for me and found me a room. The hotel rooms are very small, but elegant. I enjoyed the nice mix of ultramodern features like bathroom light and fan automatic sensors. Everything was clean and well appointed.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here the night before running the Rock N Roll Half Marathon. It's right across the street from the convention center and the race start line. The rooms are spacious and beautiful. The bathroom is nice with name-brand toiletries. Parking is a little tricky. We parked in the convention center garage across the street, which was fine. For a couple bucks more you could valet park with the hotel. The only complaint I have is that they wouldn't grant a late check out. This gave me about 1/2 hour to shower and leave the room after the run. One more hour sure would have been nice. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: I'd stay there again!

reviews.text: Now known as the Larkspur Sainte Claire. We stayed here for one night at the end of our honeymoon before flying out of San Jose. We bid for it on Priceline and got a deal ($64/night). It was a very nice hotel. It was immaculate and our room was lovely. It has a very cool, art deco feel. We parked in the nearby lot ($6 overnight). Very close to downtown, but there didn't seem to be much to see nearby. A very nice hotel and a good deal.
reviews.title: Under New Management--now a Larkspur hotel

reviews.text: For whatever reason, the Hyatt Saint Claire in San Jose is no longer a Hyatt and is now part of the Larkspur hotels group. Having stayed there once before, my experience didn't seem very different.
reviews.title: Saint Claire Alright under New Management

reviews.text: The rooms in the Saint Claire are pretty with historical furnishings, relatively small but in our case big enough to get a rollaway bed into (even if we did have to ask for it twice, after having asked when we reserved). Light was adequate, darkness was adequate at night, view even on the top 6th floor was pretty much non-existent. The room and bathroom were clean, even if the mirror was tarnished (my wife thought that was a deliberate effect). The lobby and the restaurant (which we didn't use) are very pretty.
reviews.title: Do not stay here, go anywhere but here!!!!
Returning to Our Secret Fishin' Hole
reviews.text: The valet parking situation is poor, though there's probably not much the hotel can do about it. The stopping area is just a few spaces at the intersection of two major streets--attempting to retrofit a pre-auto hotel for the automobile age. The result can be miniature traffic jams and confusion. Most weekends I could have found a parking space in city garages that are free on the weekends, but everything was filled up because of the San Jose Jazz Festival. Consider your $18 part of the cost--it's a hard city to see without a car unless you limit yourself to the downtown area.

reviews.title: Historic and Centrally Located
reviews.text: I've stayed in 5 hotels in the Downtown San Jose area. I find that the Fairmont's usually too expensive, and the Montgomery is usually too expensive for a party of three (they have some cheaper small rooms). The Marriott is something else entirely--a brand new highrise. That leaves the Saint Claire and the De Anza. The Saint Claire is fine, but overall I'd go for the De Anza--which often throws in breakfast on the weekends.

aka: The Sainte Claire Hotel San Jose
description: The Sainte Claire is one of California’s genuine grand landmarks – a stately hotel with majestic, plush interiors situated in the heart of downtown San Jose. This landmark embraces the character of yesteryear and greets the innovators of tomorrow with luxurious modern amenities and timeless service, from complimentary wireless high speed internet to the full service business center and the knowledgeable Concierge. Additionally, the hotel offers signature amenities, including L’Occitane bath and body products, and a warm, welcoming atmosphere. Relaxing and comfortable, yet inspiring and sophisticated – The Sainte Claire truly offers the best of both worlds.
